headline: How Small Target Cuts Are Shaping The J Sainsbury (LSE:SBRY) Equity Story
summary: What the Latest Price Target Tweaks Really Mean Recent Street updates on J Sainsbury centre on fine tuning rather than rewriting the story, with price targets nudged but the overall stance on the stock broadly intact. With fair value held at £3.47, a tiny move in the discount rate to 8.87% and revenue growth still anchored around 2.63%, the message is that analysts are refining their models rather than rethinking the investment case. If you want to stay on top of how this kind of subtle...
